name: The Used
description:
'''The Used''' is an American [[Rock music|rock]] band from [[Orem, Utah]], formed in 2000. The group consists of vocalist [[Bert McCracken]], bassist Jeph Howard, drummer Dan Whitesides, and guitarist Joey Bradford. Former members include [[Quinn Allman]], [[Branden Steineckert]], and [[Justin Shekoski]].

The band rose to fame in June 2002 after releasing their [[The Used (album)|self-titled debut album]]. They followed up with their second album, ''[[In Love and Death]]'', in September 2004 and their third album, ''[[Lies for the Liars]]'', in May 2007. ''Shallow Believer'', an [[Extended play|EP]] that featured most of the band's [[B-side]]s, was released in February 2008. Their fourth studio album, ''[[Artwork (album)|Artwork]]'', was released in August 2009. A fifth album, ''[[Vulnerable (The Used album)|Vulnerable]]'', was released in March 2012. In July 2013 they released another EP, titled ''[[The Ocean of the Sky]]''. Their sixth album, ''[[Imaginary Enemy (album)|Imaginary Enemy]]'', released in April 2014. Their seventh studio album, ''[[The Canyon (album)|The Canyon]]'', was released in October 2017. Their eighth studio album, ''[[Heartwork (The Used album)|Heartwork]]'', was released in April 2020 and a deluxe version with the B-sides from the recording sessions was released in September 2021. Their ninth studio album, ''[[Toxic Positivity]]'' was released in May 2023 and the B-sides from it were released on the album ''[[Medz]]'' in June 2024.

The Used have enjoyed commercial success with their albums achieving [[Music recording sales certification|gold and platinum]] statuses in many countries worldwide. ''[[Alternative Press (magazine)|Alternative Press Magazine]]'' conferred the title of "kings of the 2000s emo scene" on the band.
